intro: Koeleria brevifolia var. flavida, commonly known as the yellow foxtail, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish spikelets that are often clustered at the ends of its stems. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Koeleria brevifolia var. flavida is typically found at elevations between 2,000 and 6,000 feet.
